subject: linear_algebra
title: Dimension Theorem
contentHtml:
The Dimension Theorem states that every vector space has a basis.

This means that we can always find a set of vectors that span the entire space and are linearly independent.

theorem.statement: \[\text{Every vector space } V \text{ has a basis.}\]

intuition: This theorem is important because it allows us to work with vectors in a more manageable way. By finding a basis for a vector space, we can represent any vector as a linear combination of the basis vectors.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, this theorem has applications in feature selection and dimensionality reduction.
